text:
There are two types of people in the world: Those who speak “RuPaul’s Drag Race” and those who don’t. And Stephen Colbert helped to bridge that gap just a little by asking RuPaul for a vocabulary lesson.

RuPaul Charles stopped by the “Late Show” on Wednesday night to promote the upcoming season of “RuPaul’s Drag Race All Stars.” The appearance also served as a reunion between the 69th Emmy Awards host and the living Emmy statue.

After sharing some fond memories, Colbert took the opportunity to have the world’s most famous drag queen personally explain some Ru-isms.

“You said, and I love this, you said, ‘We’re all naked; the rest is drag,’ ” Colbert said. “What does that mean? Am I in drag right now?”

“Oh, yes, you are, honey,” RuPaul replied. “This drag is called ‘executive realness.’ ”

The “Drag Race” host then went on to clarify that that “born naked” quote is commentary on how “everybody puts on a persona to navigate this world.” Even late-night TV hosts.

But the lesson didn’t stop there.

Noting how “Drag Race” has “birthed a language all its own,” Colbert asked RuPaul to translate a few words for him. So RuPaul spilled the tea on “tee,” “okurrr” and “squirrel friends.”

Watch the lesson, and see RuPaul ask Colbert to be his squirrel friend, in the clip above.
title: RuPaul gives Stephen Colbert a lesson in 'Drag Race' vocabulary
